alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 11:34PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Franklin, southeastern Stephens, northeastern Elbert, Hart, west central Laurens, south central Greenville, Anderson, southwestern Pickens, Abbeville, eastern Oconee and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1134 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Carnesville to 13 miles east of Hartwell. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Clemson, Seneca, Hartwell, Walhalla, Abbeville, Homeland Park, Belton, Central and Williamston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
